intro: Chaptalia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf chaptalia, is a flowering plant species native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are variable in shape, ranging from ovate to linear, which contributes to its common name. Chaptalia heterophylla produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
